Reviews.Title: “Best view of Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: Eliana G
Reviews.Content: The loft was clean, staff very friendly, food was great and the view of Trevi Fountain was incredible. It was noisy at night but you couldn't ask for a better location in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value small hotel close to all the sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lisa210
Reviews.Content: We were a bit put off by the first impression of the tired red carpet stairway leading up to reception, but our room was well appointed & very clean with a modern newish bathroom. Complimentary water & tea/coffee facilities in the room was a nice touch too! It's not a glamourous hotel but it was great to come back to at the end of a long day sightseeing. The reception staff couldn't have been more helpful, giving lots of advice on everything from good value restaurants to maps & tips for avoiding the crowds at the Colosseum & Vatican...crucial if you don't want to spend your day waiting in queues! We were also delighted to find that one of the best Gelateria's in Rome was literally right next door, 'Crispina', we visited every day! Excellent value for money in a part of the city which can easily cost a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Moneypenny99
Reviews.Content: The outside of this property does not do the rooms justice. Our room was a really good size and immaculately clean and very quiet, in what is quite a busy area. The breakfast was in a sister hotel right next to Trevi fountain (a very short walk away) and was lovely with lots of hot and cold choices. The first morning we sat outside on the roof terrace overlooking the fountain and it was wonderful to take some photos while everything was quite quiet (we were lucky that the weather was really warm while we were there in March). The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the major attractions and I would certainly return here. The gelati next door is certainly worth a visit too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fantastic room!”
Reviews.Author: Joeysays
Reviews.Content: I will be staying here again when I return to Rome in the future. Travelled with my mum, on arrival, got offered a free upgrade to the blue room which was which was very clean, big and luxurious. The room offered free wi-fi, a huge flat screen tv with Sky (you can switch off the dub to English), a lovely balcony and a little kitchenette. The room was lovely and warm in February due to fantastic air-conditioning and very quiet. The staff at the desk are incredibly nice and ever-willing to help. They booked taxis, gave us restaurant advice and definitely went the extra mile. Very impressed. The location is SUPERB. Very safe and you can walk to just about anywhere. As previous people have said, slightly dubious about the lobby and reception desk, but the fantastic rooms more than make up for it. Another thing to note: Hotel right next door to San Crispino - VERY FAMOUS gelato. It felt so good to grab a cup of gelato from next door and bring it up to your room to savor rather than gobble it down on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JonPants
Reviews.Content: Slightly apprehensive on arrival as entry area and stairs are some what worn/shoddy but a big relief once inside our room. Good size room with small kitchenette area and balcony looking directly at....other buildings, but it's Rome what would you expect in a city with such high density. Quite happy with early morning stroll for breakfast – the only time you want to be near the Trevi fountain and if you’re lucky you can sit high up overlooking the fountain (watching the team of guys hovering up (pocketing) all the coins) whilst sipping your cappuccino. Bit slow on review no reflection on hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just a short walk”
Reviews.Author: gracie1606
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great option on our recent visit to Roma. Conveniently positioned next door to the best gelati in Rome! We were able to walk to just about every major attraction the city had to offer. The staff were very helpful and the accomodation was comfortable. Trevi Fountain is just steps from this establishment and is wonderful to view both day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!! Will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Adam P
Reviews.Content: We had our honeymoon in Italy and stayed here for 2 nights. It was in a great location, friendly staff, great room, and great price! It couldn't have been better :) Thanks so much Adam and Sarah

Reviews.Title: “4 night sightseeing stay November 2011”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherG-E
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable king size bed, good pillows, spotlessly clean. Good shower in separate cubicle. Tea & coffee refreshed daily. Fridge. No frills. No lift. Incredibly quiet & very convenient for all the major sights. Nearest metro (Barbarini) 10 minutes walk at most.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JaneRohan
Reviews.Content: I booked this place for a special finish to our 5 week sojourn based on most of the reviews. We had some booking issues as the extra day I booked wasn't matched up with the original booking but that was ok as we were offered an upgrade. When we arrived, we were informed that they had managed to find a room for our whole 6 day stay....unfortunately it was 'The Cave'....small, dark and with no view out of the small window. So much for the 'Special Treat'. Added to this, the website boasted pay-per-view, mini bar and slippers....minor in the scheme of things but notheless not provided!!!!! Still, the location couldn't have been better and the service was pretty good although our departure wake up call came more than half an hour late

Reviews.Title: “Best Night in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment with view of the Trevi Fountain on 9/22/11. The location was wonderful, walk right outside and you are in the middle of everything! I was expecting a sliver of a view, but it was a full view of the Trevi and could open the window and take great photos when no one was even down there! The apartment was a little on the small side, but still better than a hotel room! Expected a separate bedroom, but it was a sliding door between the living room and bedroom/bath and this door could not be shut at any time because then mother-in-law could not have gone to bathroom during the night without feeling like she was invading our privacy. She was in the living room and complained of noise from the Trevi, we did not hear a thing. She also complained that the chairs were uncomfortable in the living room, but my husband and I were never there long enough to sit. She said the pull out sofa bed was surprisingly comfortable. Beautiful updated bathroom and best shower I had in 2 weeks in Italy! Great a/c, which seems to be rare to even have around Italy! It if had been more than one night in this apt with mother-in-law it would have been very uncomfortable, but for one night with that location it was perfecto! We only stayed the one night because we were catching an early flight, but wish we had stayed here our first 3 nights at the beginning of our trip. I am so glad I did not stay near the airport, this was really the best night ever in Rome. Because of the location we were able to walk around until 1:30 in the morning and have the Trevi practically to ourselves at times. The young lady that walked us to the apartment from the main hotel helped with our bags and was very pleasant. This is the place I will choose the next time I return to Rome, without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, spacious and well-equipped room”
Reviews.Author: TJBLondon
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the bulding weren't great (slightly grubby stair carpet, 'reception area' tucked away in a small space on a landing), but welcome was friendly, and the room was clean, attractive, spacious, and well equipped. Excellent location too - just around the corner from the Trevi fountain, short walk north to the Spanish steps and Via del Corso shopping area, not too far to walk to the Colosseum, Forum, etc etc. Superb gelateria right next door, and reasonably priced wine shop a couple of doors away. Would definitely consider staying here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “So well located...”
Reviews.Author: marylg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is awesome!!! Staff is wonderful, soooo helpful!!! The room is big and comfortable. Bathroom is big as well, making it easier for 3 people to stay together in the same room. The location couldn't be better, so close to the Fontana de Trevi. Wifi is free and very good. Breakfast is great and it is served in a terrazza where you can see the Fontana de Trevi. I couldn't have chosen a better place to stay!!!! I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vegaswedding1
Reviews.Content: Relais Trevi 41 was honestly a gem in the Rome Crown. It is quiet, boutique, clean and the rooms are nice and big. The bed was also very comfortable! The location couldn't be better for the price we paid- Just around the corner from the Trevi Fountain. The staff are genuinely lovely and helpful, there is free FAST wifi. We didn't have breakfast included but it was only $10 extra each if we wanted it. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. it was a great find. Yes you have to climb a flight of stairs once you are there but the staff are more than happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ire32
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel that exceeded our expectations! The staff at reception and especially the porter were both amazingly friendly and helpful – could not ask for better service. We had the blue room which turned out to be much more spacious than the photos on the website/tripadvisor suggest – it even has tea/coffee making facilities and sink/dining area. The bathroom was also very spacious and modern - we had no issues with the shower/water as suggsted in some other reviews. The bathroom facilities were much better than others we experienced in Italy. The location is second to none – just a few minutes walk (literally) from the Trevi fountain and a wealth of eating options. (Il Gelato di San Crispino is next door – best Gelato we had in Rome!) I particularly recommend a visit to Piccolo Buco - amazing food at very reasonable prices. As you can guess from the review we were very happy with the Relais Trevi 41 and we will definitely stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: bluepaula
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in excellent location. Rooms are big and very clean. Staff are very helpful and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “small but luxurious. will be back”
Reviews.Author: b0h0l
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last may with my daughter and son and his wife. We occupied two double rooms. They are tastefully decorated. The rooms we stayed in were large, very clean, the beds very comfortable. The sheets, white and crisps were changed daily. The bathroom is of good size and very clean . the rooms are located on the second and higher floors and you go up a narrow stairway. The receptionist however was kind enough to bring our luggage up. The hotel is located on an alley but a few steps away from the trevi fountain. Breakfast buffet was served in a sister hotel round the corner and the breakfast room overlooks the trevi fountain. Food served were varied and was one of the best selections we had during our month-long travel all over europe. Be early to get the best seat at breakfast. Hotel staff were very accommodating and attentive to our needs. Since hotel is located in the heart of rome, we walked to every attraction. Staying in this hotel was one of the highlights of our stay in rome. Although rooms were not cheap, I still consider this the best value for money. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Martysmum
Reviews.Content: This is less than 30 seconds walk to the Trevi Fountain and right next door to the best Gelato shop in Italy - try the Caramel Meringue. The staff were extremely helpful, our room was spacious, quiet, clean and dark. Air con was great and free wi fi worked wonderfully. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Know the pros and cons and decide. For me: YES.”
Reviews.Author: PFV-BR
Reviews.Content: Pros: friendly staff, close to Fontana di Trevi, good rooms and bathrooms, cleaness. Cons: no elevator, breakfast is out of hotel (2 min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Skittle54
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Italy and had stayed at this hotel when we were in Rome. We found Relais Trevi 41 on Trip Advisor and booked through booking.com. We were not disappointed with our stay. Great location, 2 minutes to Trevi fountain. The staff spoke english well and were incredibly helpful in answering our questions, providing suggestions for restaurants and booking day trips. The hotel is on the second floor, no elevator but staff carried our luggage up the stairs for us. The hotel room was a bit small but had everything we needed. Clean room with modern amenities...tv, free wireless internet. Beds were very comfortable. The shower had good water pressure and lots of hot water. Overall, great value for the price. A very relaxing place to come back to after a long day. We will definitely be staying here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: jeffhinger
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel, friendly staff, terrific rooftop breakfasts included--overlooking the Trevi Fountain--at a reasonable price. We'll definitely stay with Trevi 41 the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: essexcoastmum
Reviews.Content: We were only in Rome for one night, on a whistle-stop tour, and needed somewhere central. The Relais Trevi 41 did not disappoint. The room is commensurate with one you would expect in a 4* hotel, and it was exceptionally clean. It was quiet and the aircon was a life-saver. Breakfast over the road was a feast. The staff were all very polite and helpful. The only downsides (which we expected as we had read previous reviews) were the two flights of steps and the short walk to breakfast, but we found neither of these things a problem athough we would obviously not recommend to anybody with a disablity. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Muratte Loft-Good for a final night”
Reviews.Author: podsk
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night in Rome in the Muratte Loft, of the Relais Trevi 41 which is around the corner from the hotel and does have a view of the fountain. The apartement had a kitchen which we did not use, but it did have a dishwasher. There was a solid sliding door separating the main living room with sofa bed, from the bedroom. The apartment was quite spacious and clean and had a great shower and bathroom. HOWEVER, while the bedroom was very quiet, you have to expect a fair bit of street noise from the pedestrian traffic below from the fountain and for this reason, I would be concerned about staying at the loft for an extended stay. My kids did sleep fine, but it was not till after midnight when things quiet down outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: manfri096
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Relais trevi 41 for a romantic weekend with my fiancee. Everything was perfect starting with the free upgrade we received upon arrival to a superior room (502). The same night, knowing we were in Rome for a romantic gateway, they placed fresh flowers in our room. Our room (502) was really nice and spacious, we had a leather sofa and plenty of space to move around. The breakfast was served in another building/partner hotel just 50 meters away. You get an amazing american style buffet breakfast and plus if you are lucky you can get one of those tables that overlook the Trevi fountain. What a amazing way to start the day :D! The staff of the Trevi 41 are all really friendly and they great you with a big smile every time they see you. Kudos to Gianluca, Ana and Chester at the Reception for helping me out with my flight ticket and restaurant suggestions. They have some really good local restaurant just few steps from the hotel. I will definitely stay at the Trevi 41 in the future. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: headachemom
Reviews.Content: Relais Trevi 41 was the first hotel we stayed in when we arrived in Rome. We wanted to stay near the Trevi Fountain so that we would be walking distance of most sights. And walk we did. Gianluca and the other staff at the hotel were extremely helpful. They made arrangements for a driver to meet us at the airport, and reservations for the Borghese Gallery. We received a nice surprise when we arrived for they had upgraded our standard room to a deluxe, which included breakfast at their sister hotel near the Trevi Fountain. Our room was very comfortable and clean. We heard almost no street noise at night, which is crucial to me. We stayed for 3 nights before departing for Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EinWI
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the TA forums as a recommendation for the front part of our Med Cruise. This hotel was great, outstanding location and staff! Anna at the front desk was VERY helpful in restaurant recommendations and things to do and see around Rome. The gentleman (cannot remember his name) was also extremely helpful in getting us transportation when we needed it. This hotel was very accomodating and I would highly recommend it to anyone! There is a great little restaurant just outside to the left and a gelateria next to that. Very nice! Will stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tpcrider
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in Rome for 4 nights as part of a trip around Italy in April. The location of the hotel was great. It's close to a lot and close to transportation to get to some of the farther away sights. The staff was friendly and helpful when we asked them to print a few things for us. We had a room that was on the street side of the building. There was a little bit of noise, but it didn't keep us up and we were staying in a city so it should be expected. We thought the breakfast was great. You do have to walk to the sister hotel (just around the corner), but we actually liked that it made us get up and out. The staff at breakfast was great, the food was good with a good variety and some hot food, and the atmosphere was fun. We sat outside on the terrace a couple of mornings when the weather was warm and had a nice view of the trevi fountain. I will say the shower was a little odd and on the small side, but most of the showers we experienced on our trip were. It's not something that would keep us from returning. Our room was clean and a decent size. The bed was comfortable and we slept well, which was about the only thing that was important since we spent most of our time away from the hotel. The bathroom was modern, clean and relatively spacious as well. This hotel didn't get a five rating from me, because I have stayed at nicer hotels, but for the price point and city, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carrabaun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Relais 41 for 3 nights. I'll start with the best bits..(1) excellent location but just off the main thoroughfare so nice and quiet, (2) priced a bit cheaper than neighbouring hotels, (3) room was nice size. The bit that I didn't like was that it wasn't a hotel as such but a few rooms in a building close up their main hotel. You had to walk a few mins to the main hotel for breakfast. Again, this wasn't a hindrance really for us but it might bother some people. The bedroom itself was in the back of the building and didn't have a window so that was a bit of a drawback not to be able to see natural light(felt like a bit of a cave). However the room was clean and bed very comfortable. It was also very quiet in the building. Overall I would say pick this hotel for location but it lacks any charm beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service and We Haven't Even Arrived Yet!”
Reviews.Author: jb2626
Reviews.Content: We don't plan to arrive in Rome for another 6 weeks, but I must comment on the exceptional service that we have already received from Gianluca at Relais Trevi 41. My husband and I are traveling with our college-age daughter and my parents, so our needs and interests are diverse--everything from wanting to be "where the action is" to reasonable rates and comfortable, easy-access rooms. Gianluca has responded to multiple emails of mine and answered many, detailed questions with candor and professionalism. For example, understanding that one person in our group has some knee issues, when I asked if the Red Room is as easy to access as the Blue Room, he reported back to me the size of each room and the number and size of stairs required to reach each room! Gianluca's responses show care and consideration for my family and I truly appreciate this. Having not yet experienced the property in-person, I can only say that at this point, the service and attitude of Gianluca of Relais Trevi 41 have exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well equipped room and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TillymintChester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently placed near to the Trevi fountain but on a side street so it is not noisy. You can easily walk to all the major sights in Rome so no need to use public transport. The rooms are spacious and well equipped with a kettle, tea and coffee and a fridge so you can have fresh milk and also chill your own wine and water!!! The hair dryer is a bit slow so take your own. Breakfast,( which is taken in a nearby hotel that has a terrace overlooking the Trevi.) is very good with a wide choice of both hot and cold dishes to choose from but steer clear of the orange juice, it is not fresh!!. The hotel is just rooms, there isn't a lounge or a dining room yet, though I was told a dining room is planned in the near future. Reception is manned 24 hours so there is always someone on hand to help if necessary and all the staff were helpful, friendly and polite. We found food rather expensive in Rome and not particularly good but on our last night we ate at "Taverna Antonina" on Via della Colonna Antonina, a shortish walk from the hotel, this was the best food we had in our four nights, but the little restaurant literally next door to the hotel is also quite good, especially if you don't want to walk too far!!!. Next door but one is the best ice cream parlour in Rome. Restraurants with pictures of the food they provide are best avoided!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OjaiTraveller1
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teenage daughter to Rome and stayed in the Relais Trevi; it was an awesome experience. The location was superb; we walked to all of the major attractions in Rome - Trevi Fountain (of course), Colliseum, Spanish Steps, even Vatican City (might be a bit far for some, but a very easy walk and you get to see the sights of the City). Gianluca was very helpful at the front counter and friendly upon our arrival. Don't be discouraged by the closed doors upon arrival, someone shows up quickly. One suggestion... we arrived from Termini on the metro (Barberini) in the rain, the hotel was difficult to find based on map quest directions. Just stay on Tritone until Panetteria (they intersect), don't try to follow the diagonal streets as directed on mapquest. We checked into our room, and left; upon our return a fresh flower arrangement awaited us! Very nice touch. Plenty of great restaurants just minutes away. Breakfast was great and overlooked the fountain. Oh, and the bed...it was super comfortable! Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: worldrabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in 'the blue room'. We were able to walk everywhere from here (to the Vatican, Pantheon and Colloseum). The room was clean and comfortable. (Only negative was an ill fitting toilet seat). The breakfast is served in a sister hotel about a 1 min alk away and overlooks the Tervi fountains. Good breakfast, helpful staff and great room - overall a perfect place to stay in beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beersnob75
Reviews.Content: Just stayed from December 9 - 12 and had great time. We booked a double room but were given apartment 2. It was very spacious, clean and even had a little terrace of sorts. Staff was very helpful and I would stay there again when next in Rome. Ate well at Vineria il Chianti, Rome just a few steps away (towards the Trevi Fountain), and also at Nana Vini e Cucina just to the left of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is my second time in Rome, and I...”
Reviews.Author: TgyManchester
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Rome, and I thought that I will treat myself to a nicer hotel as it was my miss's birthday, so we booked this hotel as it was so close to the trevi fountain and the pictures looked so nice. Well we weren't disappointed, the room was awesome, and we got an upgrade to a superior room for free!!!! We were so close to everything, and there is both the bus stop and the metro stop (barberini) which are both walking distance. The staff was really nice and friendly, even though the reception maybe a tad on the small side. All in all it was just an awesome stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Missing-Italy27
Reviews.Content: The Relais 41 is located just far enough away from the Trevi Fountain to provide quiet at night but close enough to walk to the restaurants and shops in the area. The view from the breakfast room of their main property, Relais Fontana di Trevi is lovely and overlooks the Trevi Fountain. The room was very clean, newly renovated and very comfortable & quiet. We had a small balcony which was an added touch. The room was a bit small, but it is Rome & we didn't spend alot of time in it. The stafff were very friendly & helpful. There is no elevator but we had our bags carried to our room. Couldn't say enough about how nice our stay was. Definitely would come back again.

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Trevi 41
HotelInfo.Address: Via Della Panetteria 41, 00187 Rome, Italy
